author: Chris Roche
content:
Hang on a moment there is still the little matter of about a million pounds for a heavy lift ship to make that sea passage as she is currently in no condition to be towed to mainland America where the former may mor easily be found I only hope a suitable sponsor can be found and quickly.

If she can be got back to the Clyde the project of replating her to a seagoing standard and re-rigging her given that most of her old standing rig masts and fittings were gas axed some years ago will be roughly three times the cost of putting JAMES CRAIG back to sea again in Australia, the CRAIG is the only comparable project and she was some 600 tons, the FALLS OF CLYDE is around 1800 tons that is the measure of the task ahead.
Chris

author: Willy
content: Now to get her back to Scottland with out sinking

author: Irwin Bryan
content:
This is wonderful to know not only will she be saved, she will also have a role in addressing climate change and may even sail again!
Thanks for keeping up with this saga and I’m sure you’ll continue to keep us informed of her progress,

author: Linda Collison
content: Good news indeed. Ironic, a sail-driven oil tanker. We visited her when she was part of the Bishop Estate’s Maritime Museum in Honolulu. Thanks to the many volunteers who kept her afloat these many decades.
